docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty top aides of the late President Salvador Allende Gossens are being held prisoner on an island in the Strait of Magellan and about 7,000 persons are imprisoned in the National Stadium in Santiago, according to one of the members of the ruling military junta.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jay Haley's new book asks us to rethink the question of how psychotherapy can make people change. Haley comes out of one of the highestenergy groups of our timethe Palo Alto research group that, in the mid-fifties, under anthropologist Gregory Bateson, formulated the "double bind" theory of schizophrenia.

headline.main: The secret ingredient seems to be love; By Ross V. Speck and Carolyn L. Attneave. 163 pp. New York: Pantheon Books. $6.95. Family Networks The Psychiatric Techniques of Milton H. Erickson, M.D. By Jay Haley. 314 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Co. $8.95. Uncommon Therapy

docs.lead_paragraph: Driven by a devotion to treating presumably hopeless patients, a New York brain surgeon has developed another in a series of techniques to reverse the incapacitating symptoms of severe neurological disorders.

headline.main: Brain 'Pacemaker' Is Helping Some With Handicaps; Electronic 'Pacemaker' Implanted in the Brain Is Helping Some With Handicaps Artery Was Cut Techniques Still Used The First Patient Cumulative Effect
